name: Kepler-254
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-254 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-254 is a star with 0.8149999999999998 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.91 times its radius. It is located 4717.68 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-254 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-254 b

Kepler-254 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 5.83 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-254.

The mass of Kepler-254 b is 24.71 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-254 b is 3.87 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-254 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-254 c

Kepler-254 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.10 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 12.41 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-254.

The mass of Kepler-254 c is 6.05 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-254 c is 2.15 that of Earth. At 6.05 Earth masses, Kepler-254 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-254 d

Kepler-254 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.14 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 18.75 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-254.

The mass of Kepler-254 d is 8.67 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-254 d is 2.5 that of Earth. At 8.67 Earth masses, Kepler-254 d is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-254, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
